humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there are metastases in 5 out of 18 lymph nodes in the first specimen (A) and metastases in 2 out of 2 lymph nodes in the second specimen (B). This brings the total number of positive lymph nodes to 7 out of 20. According to the AJCC staging system, this corresponds to N2 (N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N2 because the report indicates that metastatic carcinoma is present in 5 out of 18 lymph nodes from the right breast with axillary contents levels 1,2 and in 2 out of 2 lymph nodes from the additional axillary contents, with extranodal extension. The T stage is T2 based on the tumor size of 3 cm. Therefore, the pathologic stage is pT2N2.
